name: GENBA no Kizuna - Demo
description:
This game is currently still in development!

Story:

Sunday, September 12, 2010

When a body is found at the Kaseki Residence, once home to a world-renowned paleontologist, rookie officers Keiichi Genba, Himatsu Mizu, Rei Shirayuki and Dr. Shinketsu Kikai
are tasked with investigating the scene.

Not only do they need to uncover the identity of the victim
and reconstruct the events leading up to his untimely death…

They will also need to learn how to effectively work as a team in order to do so.

Features:

  • 4 Playable Characters through whose eyes the story will be told, each one specializing in another crucial area of crime scene investigation.

  • Interactive Gameplay Elements which will change depending on whose role you assume.
    Whereas one of the officers will take care of interviewing the parties involved, for example, only the medical examiner may interact with the body and determine the cause of death.

  • Create Bonds with your teammates by getting closer to them and learning about their pasts and motivations.

  • Digital Notebook which summarizes the story’s progression, provides you with additional info about the case and characters, and gets frequently updated to help you keep track of gathered clues and evidence.

  • Different Endings depending on who you select as the culprit, so be careful with your deductions as you might end up framing someone completely innocent!

  • Unlockable Extras including a gallery and more.

  • Original Soundtrack composed by Solo Acapello (check out some BGM samples here).

    • Demo:

    This short and early demo contains the prologue and tutorial investigation.
    Its main purpose is to give players a first idea of the feel and direction of our new project,
    and to hopefully gather some useful feedback in the process.

    If you decide to check it out, please consider sharing your impressions and suggestions!
    And if you like what you are seeing and wish to support development of this project,
    please consider checking out our Patreon!

    There, you can get WIP-glimpses at the development process, see early design sketches, listen to full BGM tracks when they are finished, read parts of the script, and even test the game to help us prepare further demos and, eventually, the final version for public release!


    For more information about GENBA no Kizuna and weekly progress updates,
    please check out our website gosatsu.com, or follow us on Twitter for the latest news!
